content.description: SDS just right of String Cheese and make a deadpoint up to a nice vertical gash for your right hand.  Climb the face between String cheese and HHH.  You will use the String cheese crack as a left sidepull.
content.protection: flat, one or two pads will work.

content.description: Start low on the far left hand side of the downhill-most face in the beefy crack line. Follow the line up to the topout

This thing is pretty misleading... It may look easy but the moves are kind of tricky 

  Start low on an undercling in the downward facing ledge that is three feet from the prominent arête under the good features.   Pop up to the good sidepull/jug feature and continue straight up to the slopey top lip via crux moves. Gain the nice bumpy/dimpled hold further back and go for gold.

On the right face of this boulder (opposite of Hippo). 

  Start on the crimps, make a couple moves, top it out!
content.protection: pads!! Maybe work on the landing?

content.description:
Sit/squat down in the hole under the arete, left hand on the arete and right on a pebble crimp. Work up the slopers on the arete and aim for an obvious 2 pebble pinch for your right hand on the face near the top. Hold the compression, hope none of the pebbles underfoot break, and slap the good slopers at the lip. 

  2-3 pads needed!  

  Good work Nick!

This one is great. As soon as you see it you have to pull on. Appetizer is named what it is since it is downhill and within sight of the Title Fight boulder, sort of an appetizer for the main course to come, although this boulder could be a focus just in itself. 

  Appetizer has a few easier lines; however "Hungry Hippo" is pretty tricky! 

  This boulder has a tall, sharp arête with a terrible landing "death Block" below, a fun featured face to its left, and a dicey thin face to the right with a likewise terrible landing. The bad landing lines could go with adequate protection I believe.
